Context: The college offers exchange programs that allow students to spend a semester or more abroad in countries like Denmark and Japan. These longer duration exchanges enable students to fully immerse themselves in the culture they are visiting. Students can take credits abroad, learn new ways of doing things, and expand their personal and professional network while paying tuition to George Brown. Exchange applications require a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA, and applicants must submit an application form, letter of intent, academic study plan, and CAPP report by the deadline date. Interviews may be conducted approximately one month after the application deadline. Successful candidates will be formally nominated to the host school for further steps. The Global Mobility team can be contacted at globalmobility@georgebrown.ca for application forms and information. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements, as the information contained in this website is subject to change without notice.
